HDR’s Water Quality Practice focuses on the application of physics, chemistry, biology, and modern mathematical modeling to understand the fate and transport of pollutants in the natural environment. One-, two-, and three-dimensional water quality models and processing tools, including visualization and animation routines, are routinely applied to problems associated with nutrients, dissolved oxygen, pathogens, metals and organic contaminants. Projects may include the design and execution of field monitoring efforts.  The primary responsibilities of the Water Quality EIT/Scientist include: Acquire, organize and analyze environmental data from a variety of sources.Set up and execute mathematical models.Perform quality-control checks on model input and results.Develop statistical and graphical (static and animations) comparisons of model results and dataParticipate in project meetings, proposal preparation, report writing and presentations. Keyword(s) Water Quality Scientist, Water Quality Modeler, job #148519,  *L-MP1 Qualifications • B.E./B.S. in environmental engineering / science required; M.E./M.S. in applicable area a plus. Would prefer candidates with 1 years relevant work experience, but will consider entry level candidates with strong educational credentials, particularly with a M.E./M.S.If educational background is in engineering, an EIT is preferred.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Strong oral and written communication skills.Excellent computer skills, including MS Excel and Word;Programming and debugging skills (e.g., MATLAB, VB/VBA, FORTRAN) are preferred.  • Self-motivated intellectual curiosity and the ability to learn through increasing levels of project responsibility Ability to work with self-direction in a project team environmentGIS skills a plus.
